column8: Moderate barnacles on rudder, prop, and waterline
Paint worn through in several areas: waterline, keel, and hull around prop and rudder.
Paint is missing along waterline at bow and rudder. Paint anti-fouling properties are failing or missing overall. Installed one heavy duty streamlined 1-1/8” shaft zinc.
Large blisters observed on keel. Increasing areas of missing paint. Haul out recommended ASAP.
Will return with additional shaft anode.

Most of the paint on starboard exhibits all of the properties of old paint, except in a few specific areas where you can see the roller strokes. In those spots, the paint is evidently new and effectively repelling growth, as it is for the entire port side. The difference is stark and delineated exactly along the keel edge between port and starboard.
